summary: A tuple-definition creates a new tuple-type in the enclosing package.
details: A tuple-definition creates a new tuple-type.
A tuple-type is a subtype of Tuple.
A tuple is immutable by default.
Let C denote the sole constructor declared by the tuple-type T:
C creates an immutable instance of T.
C takes one formal-parameter P for each element E.
P's static-type is the static-type of the element E.
C will assign the value of P to element E in the new instance.
For each element E declared by a tuple-type T in an instance I:
T contains a setter method S for element E.
The name of S is the name of E.
S takes a single formal-parameter P.
The static-type of P is the static-type of E.
S obtains a modifiable instance M of I.
If I is mutable, then M is simply I.
If I is immutable, then M is an immutable shallow copy of I.
S assigns the value of P to element E in instance M.
The return-type of S is T.
S returns M.
T contains a getter method G in element E.
The name of G is the name of E.
G does not take any formal-parameters.
The return-type of G is the static-type of element E.
G returns the value stored of element E in instance I.
A tuple-type T provides covariant versions of certain methods, which is required by Tuple.
bind(SpecialMethods) : T → bind(SpecialMethods) : Tuple
copy() : T → copy() : Tuple
mutable() : T → mutable() : Tuple
immutable() : T → immutable() : Tuple
clear() : T → clear() : Tuple
set(int, Object) : T → set(int, Object) : Tuple
set(String, Object) : T → set(String, Object) : Tuple
A tuple-type T provides a special static method instance() : T.
The method returns an instance of T in which each element is set to is default value.
The instance returned by the method is immutable.
The method always returns the same object.
The new type has public-access.
static-checks: Each annotation in an annotation-list must be uniquely typed.
Each annotation in an annotation-list must be uniquely typed.
No two types can share the same descriptor.
The name of each element must be unique within the enclosing definition.
The type specified by element.type must exist.
The type specified by element.type must be accessible.
The type of each element must be a variable-type.
